global.netscb_cur: Gauge and Counter. The current number of network session control blocks allocated since initialization (or onstat -z)
global.netscb_max: Gauge.The maximum number of network session control blocks allocated since initialization (or onstat -z)
global.connects: Gauge and Counter.The total number of connection requests since initialization
global.read: Counter.The number of network reads performed by all threads
global.write: Counter. The number of network writes performed by all threads
global.free_network_buffers_cur: Gauge. The Current number of free network buffers since initialization
global.free_network_buffers_max: Gauge. The maximum number of free network buffers since initialization
global.th_network_buffers_free: Gauge and Counter.The threshold limit for buffers on the free network buffer queues
global.th_network_buffers_norm: Gauge and Counter.The threshold limit for buffers on the normal network buffer queues
global.network_buffers_exceed_free: Gauge and Counter. The number of times the limit for buffers on the free network buffer queues has been exceeded
global.network_buffers_exceed_norm: Gauge and Counter. The number of times the limit for buffers on the normal network buffer queues has been exceeded
global.network_buffers_alloc_cur: Gauge. The currently allocated number of network buffers
global.network_buffers_alloc_max: Gauge. The maximum allocated number of network buffers

Client Type (sqlexec, srvinfx ...).Accepted: Counter. The number of connections made by this type of client that were accepted
Client Type (sqlexec, srvinfx ...).Rejected: Counter. The number of connections made by this type of client that were rejected.. Reasons for being rejected include: authentication error (bad password etc),network error on the incoming connection, wrong mode (like single user/quiescent mode but a non-allowed type tries to connect,some problem starting up a new thread
Client Type (sqlexec, srvinfx ...).Read: Counter. The number of read requests made
Client Type (sqlexec, srvinfx ...).Write: Counter. The number of write requests made
